id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the image later in your display code.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

file.docs:
**string**: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the image file.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

resize.docs:
**string**: If set, this will resize the image to fit inside the given dimensions `WIDTHxHEIGHT` and preserve the aspect ratio.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

type.docs:
Specifies how to encode image internally. Defaults to `BINARY`.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  * `GRAYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB24`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel.
  
  * `TRANSPARENT_BINARY`: One color, any pixel that is fully transparent will not be drawn, and any other pixel will be the on color. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

dither.docs:
Specifies which dither method used to process the image, only used in GRAYSCALE and BINARY type image. Defaults to `NONE`. You can read more about it [here](https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/Image.html?highlight=Dither#PIL.Image.Image.convert) and [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dither).
  * `NONE`: Every pixel convert to its nearest color.
  
  * `FLOYDSTEINBERG`: Uses Floyd-Steinberg dither to approximate the original image luminosity levels.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*
